summary: Carlton Goodlett was an individual who was re-elected to the Presidential Board of the World Peace Council (WPC) in May 1971, as documented in a cable from Budapest and a routing and record sheet summarizing American participants at the WPC conference. The documents do not explicitly state his profession or background, but his position on the Presidential Board of the WPC suggests involvement in peace and international affairs. The documents do not provide any information about Goodlett's role or significance in the JFK assassination context.
significance: The documents provided do not indicate any significance of Carlton Goodlett in the JFK assassination context.
